sections.title: A Walk Through Time
sections.content: Imagine standing amidst 200 temples, the bells tolling in the distance. Bateshwar is not just stone; it's a frozen prayer.

sections.title: The Resurrection
sections.content: Once buried under the rubble of time and ravines, these temples were painstakingly restored, piece by piece, like a giant jigsaw puzzle.

sections.title: Gurjara-Pratihara Architecture
sections.content: The temples exhibit the classic curvilinear shikhara of the North Indian Nagara style. Notice the absence of mortar.

sections.title: Restoration Techniques
sections.content: ASI led by K.K. Muhammed collaborated with local dacoits to ensure safety during the restoration in 2005.

sections.title: Iconography Analysis
sections.content: The presence of Dashavatara panels suggests a syncretic worship culture in the 9th century.

sections.title: Seismic Stability
sections.content: The interlocking stone mechanism provides a degree of seismic resistance.
